titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Paul Jacob papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Stephanie Watson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-09-01T16:35-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Writings, correspondence, press releases, campaign literature, serial issues, clippings, and memorabilia relating to activities of the Libertarian Party in the United States, its efforts to secure positions on the ballot for its candidates in various states, its opposition to military draft registration, and the trial and imprisonment of Paul Jacob in 1985 for refusal to register for the draft.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Paul Jacob papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1990.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Formed campus chapter of Libertarian Party, Westminster College, Missouri
Elected Chairman of the Libertarian Party of Arkansas
Recieved draft registration letter from the Selective Service System
Refused to register and left Arkansas to go underground
Traveled the United States speaking to students and youth about refusing to register
Indicted by grand jury for failure to register for the draft
Arrested by the FBI and sentenced to 5 years in prison
Campaign Manager, Tax Accountability Amendment Committee

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Paul Jacob papers consist of writings, correspondence, press releases, campaign literature, serial issues, clippings, and memorabilia relating to activities of the Libertarian Party in the United States, its efforts to secure positions on the ballot for its candidates in various states, its opposition to military draft registration, and the trial and imprisonment of Paul Jacob in 1985 for refusal to register for the draft. Personal correspondence, speeches, writings, clippings, and memorabilia of Jacob are also included.

The majority of the material focuses on Jacob’s draft registration resistance. Jacob traveled the United States during the early 1980s, making his anti-draft registration opinions known in speeches at Libertarian Party and non-Libertarian Party events, letters to the editors of various publication, by creating the anti-draft organization Volunteers for America, publishing the anti-war magazine Scream!, and writing an afterword published in the book The Rainbow Cadenza. Published and unpublished articles and related notes can be found in the Speeches and Writings series, while material relating to the organizations Jacob participated in can be found in the Office Files series.

In addition, Jacob held many prominent roles in the Libertarian Party throughout the 1980s. Materials such as internal memoranda, reports, notes, and printed material relating to his time as the Chairman of Arkansas, National Director, National Ballot Access Coordinator, and his time serving on the National Committee can be found in the Office Files series. Additional Libertarian Party printed material can be found in the Printed Material series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Agendas, awards, short biographies, poems, and printed materials mentioning Paul Jacob. Also includes material relating to Jacob’s arrest, court proceedings, and time spent in prison. Arranged alphabetically by physical form.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters sent and received by Paul Jacob while in prison. Also includes correspondence with various Libertarian Party committees, the Paul Jacob Defense Fund, the Selective Service System, Volunteers for America, and private individuals, arranged alphabetically by correspondent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts, notes, and typescripts of speeches given by Paul Jacob. Also includes published and unpublished writings and personal statements, as well as transcripts of interviews. Arranged chronologically, then alphabetically thereunder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles and other writings mainly related to Libertarianism and war, arranged alphabetically by author.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda, reports, notes, and printed material relating to the Libertarian committees and anti-draft organizations Paul Jacob participated in. Arranged alphabetically by organization, then alphabetically by title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clippings, flyers, newsletters, pamphlets, and periodicals related to the anti-draft movement of the 1980s and Libertarian ideology.

did.unittitle: "Defense Debate: Ronald Reagan vs Walter Mondale,"
Songs of Liberty: Music of the Revolutionary War, The Colonial Williamsburg Foundation,
"Speech and Questions at The State University of New York at Binghamton,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Eight nametags, sixteen pins, two t-shirts, one ribbon, and one cocktail napkin.
